alert.note: Alert for Bath; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 5:44PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Morgan, southeastern Bath and Rowan Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 543 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Salt Lick, or 8 miles east of Owingsville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Farmers around 550 PM EDT. Bluestone, Freestone, Cogswell, Zilpo and Yale around 555 PM EDT. Brandy, Clearfield and Munson around 600 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Morehead, Rodburn, Pelfrey, Lick Fork, Crix, Christy, Gates, Craney, Hamm, Haldeman and Blairs Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
